body: We need to get this to an LGTM state as far as code and unit tests, and then there will be a little dance with the integration testing story. It may save a lot of effort to allow some integration testing failure as we update things that link in the SDK, or we might be able to hack a simple solution.

A bit of flavor on the motivation by this change, which might otherwise look bigger than it needs to be:
- `ParDo.apply` always clones its argument immediately via serialization to support the (very questionable IMO) use case of a user who wants to repeatedly mutate their `DoFn` while re-using it, and have each of the re-uses keep the value at the time of `apply`. To me, this contradicts the general semantics of Java...
- But anyhow in that case, transient fields end up `null` so I had to make the types non-transient.
- But even though `TypeDescriptor` is serializable, `TypeVariable` is not (this is why they were transient in the first place). And this fix is _specifically_ for cases where both the input type and output type contain type variables.
- So I "swapped the polarity" on whether the underlying transform stashes a `SimpleFunction` or a `SerializableFunction` plus type descriptors.
- That broke display data for a minute, since it looked directly at the classes, and in the process of fixing that, I just added display data to the functions. The fix didn't actually require this latter bit.

So this is my best approach to getting a good `TypeDescriptor` for both input and output without every having to serialize them.

R: @dhalperi @swegner

@wikier I have tried this with mvn `3.3.9` and mojo plugin `1.4.0` and `1.5.0` and I can still reproduce.

I managed to get this running by disabling the inheritance on the root pom.xml. Adding `<inherited>false</inherited>` in the root pom.xml as below fixes the problem.

```
...
          <version>1.4.0</version>
          <inherited>false</inherited>
          <executions>
...

```

@dhalperi , is this an acceptable solution? Would it introduce problems with other pom files that needs to inherit from the root?
Thanks to your comments in #756, I've fixed this one up. They are now disjoint, but this one will have to merge first.
R: -@swegner love the feedback but this PR may or may not remain interesting to you

Thanks Dan.

I don't think we should expose path validator as a Beam concept. I believe longer term that PTransforms will need parameterization. Thus the IO PTransforms will have a schema like filepattern/table/... that will allow runners to do this kind of validation without needing to have access to the language specific constructs (classes, py modules, ...)

By the way, this is still missing tests for the `SideInputReader`, `DoFnOperator` and `WindowDoFnOperator`. We shouldn't merge like this, I'll add those shortly.

@aaltay in Maven by default plugin configuration is propagated to child modules ([`inherited=true`](https://maven.apache.org/guides/mini/guide-configuring-plugins.html#Using_the_inherited_Tag_In_Build_Plugins)), so I guess that would break other child modules who depend on the `exec:java` configuration form the parent pom.

The real solution would be to [skip `exec:java`](http://www.mojohaus.org/exec-maven-plugin/java-mojo.html#skip) just on the Python SDK, but I didn't manage to get it working in my previous tries. I'll give it another shot...

LGTM

Can you elaborate on what "quiescence to drive the Direct Runner" means? Quiescent could mean "pipeline is completely done, no more input could arrive because all input watermarks are past end of window", but that doesn't seem to agree with "the executor should add work whenever it becomes quiescent".
Jenkins is red.
Jenkins rightly took issue with a poorly place linebreak. Fixed.
+R: @dhalperi
We just discussed with Amit about having two different spark runners (one for Spark 1.x, another one for Spark 2.x). So, this PR could be merged on the Spark 1.x runner.

I'm using the Quiescence that is described in the [More Expressive Beam Tests document](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1fZUUbG2LxBtqCVabQshldXIhkMcXepsbv2vuuny8Ix4/edit#heading=h.jctpsyfl9ks0)

More specifically, as defined here, a Pipeline is Quiescent when:
- There are no triggers that can fire with the current processing time and watermark
  - The watermark is advanced as far as is possible for all `PCollections`
- All pending elements cannot make progress until a side input produces additional output

Elements that are buffered in state are not considered to be pending elements.

This means that, absent advances in processing time or watermarks, the pipeline will not make progress unless new input is added.

This is also documented on the added [ExecutorState enum](https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/754/files#diff-8f0888656bce6a94d1f5c219892c04adR497)
Thanks Dan.
Curious what the impact on build test really is. We should actually need to run `mvn install` twice like we do.
+R: @amitsela @dhalperi
Are we modifying wordcount so that it counts the words in the apache license instead of the shakespeare example?

For the reason of SparkRunner can't resolve `gs://` right now. Also there is a concern that using apache license instead of shakespeare example can avoid apache license issue if we want to put it in the project build.
Sure, makes sense to me.
